doc.title: Product Brief: Social Music
doc.snippet: Simple Dashboard: View all posts, Track posting status, View generated content. Rationale: User needs visibility into their content.

doc.title: Technical Specification
doc.snippet: Build the foundational UI structure and navigation system for the Social Music platform. This includes creating dashboard layout with sidebar navigation, building placeholder pages for video generation and posts management, implementing header with user menu and footer with social links.

doc.title: Technical Specification
doc.snippet: Frontend: Next.js 14.2.0 (App Router), React 18.3.1, TypeScript 5.3.3, Tailwind CSS 3.4.1, shadcn/ui components (existing). Backend: Supabase Auth (existing), Supabase PostgreSQL 15.1, Supabase JavaScript Client 2.39.3.

doc.title: Technical Specification
doc.snippet: Sidebar Navigation: Dashboard (home icon), Video Generation (video icon), Posts Management (list icon). Active state highlighting. Collapsible on mobile. User profile section at bottom.

doc.title: Technical Specification
doc.snippet: Protected Routes: Protect `/dashboard/*` routes. Redirect unauthenticated users to login. Use existing Supabase middleware.

doc.title: UX Design Standard
doc.snippet: Primary Button: background: linear-gradient(135deg, #8B5CF6, #3B82F6), color: white, padding: 12px 24px, border-radius: 8px, font-weight: 600, font-size: 16px, box-shadow: 0 4px 12px rgba(139, 92, 246, 0.3)

doc.title: UX Design Standard
doc.snippet: Primary Colors: Primary Purple: #8B5CF6 (Violet-500), Primary Blue: #3B82F6 (Blue-500), Gradient: Linear gradient from Purple to Blue (#8B5CF6 → #3B82F6)

doc.title: UX Design Standard
doc.snippet: Width: 256px, Background: #F8FAFC, Active State: Purple background with white text, Hover State: Light purple background

doc.title: Epics and Stories
doc.snippet: Epic 1.1: Project Backbone - Build foundational UI structure with dashboard layout, navigation, and placeholder pages for core features

doc.title: Brainstorming Session Results
doc.snippet: Speed, minimal friction, producer control, automation, simplicity. Visual consistency across all platforms.

file.reason: Existing middleware for route protection that will need to be extended to protect /dashboard/* routes
Supabase session management that handles authentication checking and redirects
Client-side Supabase client for authentication operations
Server-side Supabase client for authenticated operations in dashboard
Existing login component that users will be redirected to from protected dashboard routes
Root layout with ThemeProvider and Geist font - dashboard layout should inherit from this
Example of existing protected layout pattern to reference for dashboard layout structure
shadcn/ui button component to use for all buttons in dashboard navigation and CTAs
Utility for merging Tailwind classes with clsx and tailwind-merge

interface.signature: export async function middleware(request: NextRequest): Promise<NextResponse>

constraints.constraint: Use Next.js 14 App Router with React Server Components (existing pattern)
Follow Tailwind CSS styling with shadcn/ui components (existing UI library)
Protect all /dashboard/* routes using existing Supabase auth middleware
Follow UX design standard: purple/blue gradient primary colors, modern minimalist aesthetic
Ensure responsive design: mobile (< 768px), tablet (768-1023px), desktop (≥ 1024px)
Use TypeScript for all components with proper type safety
Maintain consistent navigation pattern across all dashboard pages
All buttons should use gradient background (linear-gradient(135deg, #8B5CF6, #3B82F6))
Sidebar width: 256px fixed on desktop, collapsible on mobile
Use lucide-react icons for all iconography

tests.standards: Testing approach: Use Jest for unit tests, React Testing Library for component tests, and manual testing for responsive design. Focus on navigation flow, protected route redirects, and component rendering. No E2E tests required for this story.
